greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of Motzkin paths of length n, starting with an up step, ending with a down step and having no peaks (can be easily expressed using RNA secondary structure terminology).
example: a(6)=5 because we have UHHHHD, UHDUHD, UUHHDD, UHUHDD and UUHDHD, where U=(1,1), D=(1,-1) and H=(1,0).
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Sep 11 2004
